Hymn.Arabic: 16 سَقَطَ إِكْلِيلُ رَأْسِنَا. وَيْلٌ لَنَا لأَنَّنَا قَدْ أَخْطَأْنَا.,
Hymn.English: 16 The crown has fallen [from] our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned!,

Hymn.Arabic: 17 مِنْ أَجْلِ هذَا حَزِنَ قَلْبُنَا. مِنْ أَجْلِ هذِهِ أَظْلَمَتْ عُيُونُنَا.
Hymn.English: 17 Because of this our heart is faint; Because of these [things] our eyes grow dim;

Hymn.Arabic: 18 مِنْ أَجْلِ جَبَلِ صِهْيَوْنَ الْخَرِبِ. الثَّعَالِبُ مَاشِيَةٌ فِيهِ.
Hymn.English: 18 Because of Mount Zion which is desolate, With foxes walking about on it.

Hymn.Arabic: 19 أَنْتَ يَا رَبُّ إِلَى الأَبَدِ تَجْلِسُ. كُرْسِيُّكَ إِلَى دَوْرٍ فَدَوْرٍ.
Hymn.English: 19 You, O LORD, remain forever; Your throne from generation to generation.

Hymn.Arabic: 20 لِمَاذَا تَنْسَانَا إِلَى الأَبَدِ وَتَتْرُكُنَا طُولَ الأَيَّامِ؟
Hymn.English: 20 Why do You forget us forever, [And] forsake us for so long a time?

Hymn.Arabic: 21 اُرْدُدْنَا يَا رَبُّ إِلَيْكَ فَنَرْتَدَّ. جَدِّدْ أَيَّامَنَا كَالْقَدِيمِ.
Hymn.English: 21 Turn us back to You, O LORD, and we will be restored; Renew our days as of old

Hymn.Arabic: 22 هَلْ كُلَّ الرَّفْضِ رَفَضْتَنَا؟ هَلْ غَضِبْتَ عَلَيْنَا جِدًّا؟
Hymn.English: 22 Unless You have utterly rejected us, [And] are very angry with us!
Praise be to God forever. Amen.
